transcript_segments.text: Assalamu Alaikum dear viewers! A warm welcome to all my lovely subscribers, both new and old. Today, I'm sharing with you a delicious Kolkata-style chicken biryani recipe. Be sure to try this on Eid. Many of you had requested this recipe for a long time—specifically Kolkata-style chicken biryani—so here it is!

If you're a biryani lover, check out the playlist on my channel for many varieties of biryani. If you want a specific type, let me know in the comments. It might take a little time, but I’ll definitely upload it. Now let’s quickly see how to make this amazing biryani.

To make chicken biryani, start with 400 grams of oil. Once the oil is hot, reduce the flame to medium and add 300 grams of finely chopped onions. Fry the onions on medium flame until golden brown—this is called 'beresta'.

As you can see, the onions have fried well. Quickly remove them. Always use more onions when making beresta because they shrink when fried. I used 300 grams of onions and 400 grams of oil, which is the amount needed for this biryani.

It’s been 20 minutes of cooking chicken on low to medium heat. It should be cooked about 70%—not fully. Fully cooking it will cause it to break apart during dum. I’ve cooked it for 20 minutes on low to medium flame.

Then layer the cooked chicken all around. This is an authentic Kolkata biryani recipe. Make it for Eid and leave a comment. Always keep potatoes in the middle and chicken around the sides—otherwise, the chicken will become too soft. Keep this in mind.
This biryani does NOT use yakhni layers (repeats this multiple times). Do not add yakhni multiple times. Once is enough.

Our Kolkata-style chicken biryani is ready! It smells amazing—just like restaurant biryani. Do try it and follow all steps exactly. Look at the rice—it’s fluffy and separate.

Make sure to cook the rice only 70% and follow the dum timings I told you. If you do everything as instructed, you can make perfect biryani at home. The correct way to serve is to first separate the rice, then gently take out the chicken and potatoes without mixing everything.

Separate the top and bottom layers—top plain rice, bottom spiced rice—and mix them lightly while serving. That’s the correct way. Whenever you try this biryani, comment below and let me know how it turned out. If you liked my recipe, please like my channel.
